e4: Switching to a policy of unbiased earnings reporting aligns the company with regulatory standards and ethical norms. It enhances credibility and transparency, reducing legal and reputational risks associated with giving inaccurate financial information, even if informally compensated by investor assumptions. In the long run, clear communication of this adjustment will aid in correcting misconceptions.
e5: An ethical reporting policy is transparent, accurate, and upholds honesty. It avoids deliberate distortions or omissions and caters to various stakeholders ethically and equitably. This means considering the intent to provide a truthful reflection of the company’s performance, guarding against misinformation bypassing technical rules or assumptions. It also involves clear communication to all investor types, accounting for differing information access.
e6: What strategies would be proposed to effectively communicate the policy change to various investor segments? Also, how will the company evaluate the new policy’s impact on the stock performance and investor relations, particularly regarding retail investors? Lastly, did management perform risk assessments on litigation of current practices?
